Article-Links: Changes to FIL statutes to help governing body regulate emergency cases like war in Ukraine approved at Congress
Articles-Content: Among the many proposals put forward by the Executive Board, the "emergency paragraph" which regulates cases of "force majeure" like wars, pandemics and other disasters was approved by a two-thirds majority.
gist: The International Luge Federation (FIL) has brought in adaptations to its statutes, which will allow the worldwide governing body to regulate emergency cases such as the war in Ukraine, on the opening day of its Congress in Austria.

Article-Links: Changes to FIL statutes to help governing body regulate emergency cases like war in Ukraine approved at Congress

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: A presentation by Federico Addiechi, who is the head of sustainability and environment at football’s worldwide governing body, at the 12th Play the Game conference in Odense stressed on why climate change should be taken more seriously.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: Author David Goldblatt, Denmark National Olympic Committee and Sports Confederation Board member Rikke Rønholt, University of Colorado Boulder professor Roger Pielke and Danish Foundation for Culture and Sports Facilities consultant Jakob Færch were the panellists present during the session titled "Playing against the clock: Can sport contain climate change?".
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: "Since 2010, FIFA has been measuring and offsetting carbon emissions, as well as engaging with stakeholders to understand climate change impacts and find solutions," Addiechi said.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: "FIFA will continue to take climate action leadership by engaging actively and collectively with member associations, teams, players, fans, other sports, [parties to] the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and other key stakeholders and reaching climate neutrality by 2040.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: "As the title of this panel correctly says, we are all playing against the clock.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: "We need to review how we do sport fundamentally, not only to contribute to reducing emissions but also to adapt our sports to the changes in our climate and physical environment so that they can be enjoyed by future generations, just as we have been enjoying them."
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: FIFA was the first sports federation to join the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change’s (UNFCCC) Climate Neutral Now campaign and also became a founding signatory to the UNFCCC Sports for Climate Action Framework in 2016 at the United Nation’s Climate Change Conference (COP24) in Poland.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: Apart from other climate-related commitments, the International Federation also launched the Green Card for the Planet campaign focused on protecting the environment.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: FIFA urges international sports federations to focus on climate change
Articles-Content: FIFA has also pledged to measure, mitigate, and offset emissions with the help of Qatar’s Supreme Committee for Delivery and Legacy at the World Cup this year.
gist: FIFA has called for sports organisations around the world to take necessary action to tackle climate change.

Article-Links: AOC celebrates NAIDOC week with "Walk with Us" forum
Articles-Content: AOC chief executive Matt Carroll, Athletes’ Commission members Kenny Wallace and Greta Small and director of From the Heart Dean Parkin were joined by indigenous Olympians Patrick Johnson, Beki Smith, Danny Morseu and Kyle van der Kuyp for the event at Meta Headquarters in Barangaroo, Sydney.

Article-Links: AOC celebrates NAIDOC week with "Walk with Us" forum
